https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole where a cap (usually a PVC cap secured with a screw) or a plug have been put temporarily in place during interim rehabilitation or to allow for the possibility of re-entering the hole (e.g., during a pause in operations and/or maintenance), e.g., to prevent fauna from falling into the hole. A permanent rehabilitation should follow at the completion of the operations.
The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.

An alternative lexical label for a resource
Relates a concept to a concept that is more general in meaning
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept

skos:exactMatch is used to link two concepts, indicating a high degree of confidence that the concepts can be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications. skos:exactMatch is a transitive property, and is a sub-property of skos:closeMatch
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language

The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operatorâ€™s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A borehole where a cap (usually a PVC cap secured with a screw) or a plug have been put temporarily in place during interim rehabilitation or to allow for the possibility of re-entering the hole (e.g. during a pause in operations and/or maintenance), e.g. to prevent fauna from falling into the hole. A permanent rehabilitation should follow at the completion of the operations.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Mineral industry concept; definition adapted from DEMIRS Exploration and Prospecting Rehabilitation Guidance (v. 1, December 2023) (https://www.dmp.wa.gov.au/Documents/Environment/Exploration-Rehabilitation-Guidance (v. 1, December 2023).pdf).
